item.title: Docker is not a Virtual Machine
item.description: Docker is not a VM. Neither is it a lightweight VM. But what’s the difference? My dockerfile needs an image of an OS (e.g. Ubuntu) to run, and virtual machines (such as VirtualBox) requires an image of an OS to also run, and both produce similar runtime environments for me to run the code in. Don’t they do the same thing? The difference is what resources they virtualize. Hypervisors & Virtual Machines in 30s Hypervisors (Virtual Machine Managers) emulate hardware resources.
